title: Instant Pot Ribs from Frozen Recipe
description: This frozen ribs Instant Pot dinner is quickly made with hickory smoke seasoned baby back ribs cooked until tender, then broiled with barbecue sauce.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Sauces BBQ Sauce Recipes Instant Pot Ribs from Frozen 4.8 (19) 17 Reviews 6 Photos This frozen ribs Instant Pot dinner can be made without planning. Each rib portion should have 3 to 4 ribs. I use a spice called Red Rocks Hickory Smoke Seasoning from Savory Spice Shop, but you may use what you have. With only 3 ingredients, it doesn't get much easier! Submitted by thedailygourmet Updated on August 19, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Additional Time: 15 mins Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ½ cup water 3 tablespoons hickory smoke seasoning (such as Savory Spice® Red Rocks) 1 rack frozen baby back ribs, membrane removed and cut into 4 slabs ¼ cup barbecue sauce Directions Pour water into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Set the trivet inside. Sprinkle hickory smoke seasoning liberally over frozen ribs; set ribs on top of the trivet. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 45 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 15 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Preheat the oven broiler. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source. Transfer ribs to a rimmed baking sheet. Brush with barbecue sauce. Broil until glazed, 4 to 5 minutes. Add Your Photo Photos of Instant Pot Ribs from Frozen 01 of 06 Photo by  Grocery Addict 02 of 06 Photo by  Grocery Addict 08/11/2024 Easy to follow This recipe was great for getting crave-worthy fall-off-the-bone texture in a flash. Rather than use the broiler, we popped them in the smoker for an hour after pressure cooking, then served the BBQ sauce on the side because we couldn’t decide which one to use. So yummy! 03 of 06 Photo by  IndigoPeach6383 06/17/2024 Well it wouldn't let me change my last review but I was wrong they are not dry it was just that one corner for some reason. I did add a little bit of brown sugar and butter when I broiled them and they turn out amazing. 04 of 06 Photo by  HandySoda2697 04/09/2023 This is the way to go for tasty tender ribs from frozen to table in an hour. 05 of 06 Photo by  Walter Brumfield 03/02/2021 06 of 06 Photo by  thedailygourmet 04/05/2020 1 You’ll Also Love Air Fryer Baby Back Ribs 37 Ratings Electric Smoker BBQ Rib Tips Easy Keto Barbecue Chicken Thighs BBQ Ribs on the Grill 5 Ratings Slow-Cooker Teriyaki Ribs 14 Ratings Instant Pot® BBQ Cheddar Meatloaf 9 Ratings Instant Pot Pulled Pork Sandwiches 27 Ratings Instant Pot BBQ Rib Tips 5 Ratings Keto BBQ Ribs Best Pressure Cooker Sticky BBQ Ribs Ever 5 Ratings Strawberry Jalapeno Smoked Ribs 2 Ratings Fall-off-the-Bone Instant Pot Ribs 123 Ratings Tangy BBQ Meatball Sliders 2 Ratings Maple Glazed Ribs 216 Ratings Spicy Korean Ribs 17 Ratings Chef John's Copycat McRib Sandwich 34 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: thedailygourmet
instructions: Pour water into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Set the trivet inside.;Sprinkle hickory smoke seasoning liberally over frozen ribs; set ribs on top of the trivet. Close and lock the lid.;Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 45 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.;Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 15 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid.;Preheat the oven broiler. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source.;Transfer ribs to a rimmed baking sheet. Brush with barbecue sauce. Broil until glazed, 4 to 5 minutes.
